definition: according to reason/in the ordinary course of events/normally
to press/to push/to leave aside or shelve/to control/to restrain/to keep one's hand on/to check or refer to/according to/in the light of/(of an editor or author) to make a comment
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
it is reasonable to say that...

sentences.english: It would make sense that the richer that people became, the less they would save.
sentences.chinese: 按理说，人们越富裕，储蓄率越低才对。

sentences.english: It must have haunted him until his dying day.
sentences.chinese: 按理说，他应该感到内疚，直到他死去的那一天。

sentences.english: By rights, I think he should have an opportunity to reply to our criticizm.
sentences.chinese: 按理，我认为他应该有对我们的批评进行答辩的权利。

sentences.english: Therefore, anyone can locally host a web site.
sentences.chinese: 按理说，任何人都能本地发布站点。

sentences.english: Normally there are no complications with the medicine.
sentences.chinese: 服用这种药按理不会产生并发症。

sentences.english: Sundays are supposed to be a day of rest and quiet reflection.
sentences.chinese: 周日按理说是休息和自我反思的好时节。

sentences.english: By rights, some tropical fish reproduce by laying eggs.
sentences.chinese: 按理说，有些热带鱼靠产卵繁殖。

sentences.english: Normally, this treatment mentality should be calm.
sentences.chinese: 按理，这攀比的心态应该平复了吧。

sentences.english: The twin-engine plane is supposed to be able to fly on one engine.
sentences.chinese: 这架双引擎飞机按理说靠一个引擎也能飞。

sentences.english: Arguably, all he has left is the bully pulpit.
sentences.chinese: 按理说，留给他的只有这座天字一号的讲坛。

sentences.english: The Miller ought to call on Hans in the winter.
sentences.chinese: 按理，磨房主应该在冬天去看望汉斯。

sentences.english: We charge extra fee at 100% of the rates of tallying fees.
sentences.chinese: 我们按理货收费率的100%收取附加费。

definition: according to reason/usually/in the normal course of events/to attend to
in the ordinary course of events/ordinarily/normally
common sense/conventional reasoning and morals
moreover/besides/in addition/furthermore
reasonable and fair (idiom)
to calculate/to estimate/in total/all told/(fig.) if you think about it
should/ought to
moreover/besides
let alone/to say nothing of/besides/what's more
certainly
moreover/besides
not to mention/leaving aside
normally/ordinarily speaking
see 未可厚非[wei4 ke3 hou4 fei1]
most likely/mostly (in 8 or 9 cases out of 10)/vast majority
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
